thread.title: Live: Khattar appeals for peace and harmony
thread.title_full: Live: Khattar appeals for peace and harmony

title: Live: Khattar appeals for peace and harmony
text:
06:01 PM (IST) Appeal to the people that they should cooperate to maintain peace and harmony: Haryana CM #JatAgitation pic.twitter.com/N2z0vZaDSX — ANI (@ANI_news) March 19, 2017 05:59 PM (IST) Tomorrow's Delhi Kooch programme has been suspended. Jats will not come to Delhi: Jat leader Yashpal Malik (ANI) 05:58 PM (IST) We've assured Govt that tomorrow's Delhi Kooch programme has been suspended and now Jats would not come to Delhi: Yashpal Malik, Jat leader pic.twitter.com/TwKAew3ErL — ANI (@ANI_news) March 19, 2017 05:56 PM (IST) Jat reservation process to begin at Centre after appointment of Chairman & members of National Commission for Backward Classes: Khattar 05:55 PM (IST) Jat reservation process at centre will begin after appointment of chairman & members of National Commission for Backward Classes: ML Khattar pic.twitter.com/YqKnibMaRm — ANI (@ANI_news) March 19, 2017 05:54 PM (IST) "Injured will be given compensation and there will be a probe into those behind violence,"said Khattar after the deadlock with Jat leaders ended. 05:51 PM (IST) Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar says they have come to an agreement with Jat leaders. 05:40 PM (IST) Jat quota stir called off after Jat leaders met Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar. 04:59 PM (IST) 
Officials supervising forces' deployment said a total of 247 companies of these forces have been tasked to secure various locations in and around the national capital region and parts of Haryana and Uttar Pradesh. 04:42 PM (IST) 
Haryana DGP K P Singh today said security has been stepped up and all highways and other roads passing through the state will remain open so that students do not face any problems in the wake of Jat protests 04:30 PM (IST) — ANI (@ANI_news) March 19, 2017 04:11 PM (IST) Haryana CM held talks with the agitating Jat leaders from the state on the quota issue ahead of their planned march to Parliament. (PTI) 04:09 PM (IST) Metro trains will not travel beyond the city's borders from 11.30 PM while 12 stations in Central Delhi will be shut from 8 PM till further orders. (PTI) 04:07 PM (IST) Delhi Police to impose prohibitory orders and traffic restrictions in order to prevent Jat community members from going ahead with their march to Parliament. (PTI) 03:56 PM (IST) DGP Singh said ban had been placed on plying tractor-trolleys to Delhi, besides using tractor-trolleys as a means of transport in Haryana and Delhi. (PTI) 03:49 PM (IST) "All security measures have been taken, so that people, especially students who are appearing in the CBSE Board examinations on March 20, may travel through the state without any fear, said the DGP. 03:47 PM (IST) Haryana DGP K P Singh said security has been stepped up and all highways and other roads passing through the state will remain open. (PTI) 02:48 PM (IST) DSP Gurdial Singh of Fatehabad seriously injured in the protest, referred to Agroha Medical College and Hospital 02:46 PM (IST) We have 7 issues which can be resolved through dialogue. Hope to build a common consensus, says Jat leader Yashpal Malik 02:45 PM (IST) Jat protest will be peaceful. Next course of action to be decided after meeting CM Manohar Lal Khattar: AIJASS chief Yashpal Malik 02:39 PM (IST) One DSP injured as jat activists clash with cops in Fatehabad. Police use force to disperse the agitators. 02:14 PM (IST) In a bid to call off the stir, Haryana chief minister Manohar Lal Khattar and Jat leader Yashpal Maiik to meet at 2.30pm in New Delhi 01:56 PM (IST) Manic Monday likely with traffic curbs for Jat march 
Brace for major traffic chaos in the city and other NCR areas on Monday with the traffic police putting much of central Delhi in lockdown mode and imposing restrictions on Metro services in NCR in anticipation of the march by Jats from Haryana. 01:55 PM (IST) 
Ahead of threats by Jat groups to intensify their agitation this week, Central Board of Secondary Education has issued an advisory on Saturday to parents and students appearing for their Class 10 and Class 12 board exams on Monday. From around the web More from The Times of India Recommended By Colombia
